column4: If you go to open with - other application, does it list your IDE?
hi it does not list my iDE though it is working just fine in ubuntu
i will be very grateful for any help given
itis currently in a folder under /home/myusername/Komodo-IDE-5

Hmm, that I think should not make a difference there, I guess you might have to associate it manually, if you go to the list of programs again, and use a custom command, something like "/home/user/Komodo-IDE-5/komodo.bin" maybe?
the application is komodo ide. its currently in /home/myusername/Komodo-IDE-5 should i move i to /opt
it worked with thhe custom command. thanks
:)  A bit strange that it failed to associate itself when it installed...
oh no i have to right click > open with everytime
it does not auto open with Komodo IDE everytime
for the file, you should be able to set the "default program for these types of files there from a list of alternatives, where your custom command should be present"
(right-click on the file - properties - open with)

there is no such thing. there is a remember this application checkbox. but that didnt work. i did it twice, and now komodo appears twice inside the list of applications. i got some applications appearing like 5 or 6 times in the list of possible applications
